intro: Coussapoa rhamnoides, commonly known as the Brazilian nettle or Brazilian holly, is a shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, berry-like fruits. It is a member of the Rhamnaceae family, which includes other shrubs and trees with similar structural features. Coussapoa rhamnoides is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
